timeline.message: Add is empty check for blank feedback

timeline.bodyText: always issues with "0" evaluating to false 😄
timeline.author: fde312

replies.bodyText: should we not check for undefined instead of null?
replies.author: krusche
krusche

replies.bodyText: I know it does not really make a difference, but we would like to avoid null and focus on undefined so I think it's better to use it
replies.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: a == null checks for null and undefined. I think the check is better because it fends against more errors.
replies.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText:
I would also support @kloessst, see here:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28975896/is-there-a-way-to-check-for-both-null-and-undefined
I think checking only for undefined should be then === instead of your suggested == @krusche
replies.author: fde312

replies.bodyText:
I think == undefined is logically the same as == null. Both check for null and undefined
Look at my proposal, I do not propose === undefined which would be different.
We basically want to consistently use undefined instead of null in the client code (if possible), so I would prefer to not use null at all (if possible)
replies.author: krusche

replies.bodyText:
@krusche jope, you are right. my bad!
See: https://dorey.github.io/JavaScript-Equality-Table/
replies.author: fde312
